intro: Acronia deflexa, commonly known as the curled-leaf acronia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, curling leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Acronia deflexa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially sunny habitats. Its unique morphology makes it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturalists alike.
